perturbation.original_text: TERM: The rights granted hereunder shall be effective as of the Effective Date and shall expire on December 31, 2006 (the “Term”); provided, however, that with respect to each Property, including Robots, Kingdom of Heaven, Mr. and Mrs. Smith, In Her Shoes, Idiocracy (Oww My Balls) and Ice Age II, all right and licenses granted herein will continue in full force and effect until March 31, 2008.
perturbation.changed_text: TERM: The rights granted hereunder shall be effective as of the Effective Date and shall expire on December 31, 2006 (the “Term”); provided, however, that with respect to each Property, including Robots, Kingdom of Heaven, Mr. and Mrs. Smith, In Her Shoes, Idiocracy (Oww My Balls) and Ice Age II, all right and licenses granted herein will continue in full force and effect until March 31, 2008. Notwithstanding the above, Glu Mobile Inc. reserves the right to terminate the license for any of the listed properties at any time after December 31, 2007, with 30 days written notice.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction. The original clause states that rights continue until March 31, 2008, for specific properties. The added sentence allows Glu Mobile to terminate these licenses after December 31, 2007, potentially overriding the original expiration date and creating uncertainty about the actual term length and termination conditions.

perturbation.original_text: NOTICE PROVISION: The notice information for Licensee in Section 17(a) of the Agreement shall be amended such that “Paul Zuzelo” is deleted and replaced with “General Counsel”, and such that the email address for Paul Zuzelo is deleted.
perturbation.changed_text: NOTICE PROVISION: The notice information for Licensee in Section 17(a) of the Agreement shall be amended such that “Paul Zuzelo” is deleted and replaced with “General Counsel”, and such that the email address for Paul Zuzelo is deleted. However, for all legal notices pertaining to intellectual property rights, Fox Mobile Entertainment will continue to send copies of such notices to Paul Zuzelo at his previously listed email address.
perturbation.explanation: This amendment initially removes Paul Zuzelo from the notice provision but then contradicts itself by requiring copies of legal notices related to intellectual property to still be sent to him. This creates confusion about who the official point of contact is for various types of notices.
